title.narrative: Saving lives and protecting the livelihood of people affected by COVID-19 related restrictions, desert locust and flood in Liben cluster

description.narrative: The humanitarian situation in the Liben cluster under the RESET II program worsening due to the combining effects of multiple crises. COVID-19-related restrictions, coupled with the broader economic decline, the spread of desert locust infestation, flooding, and the general decrease in income has led to atypically high humanitarian needs across the Liben cluster. An increase in food commodities and essential non-food commodities prices have been continuing due to poor terms of trade in the flood-affected woredas. This has resulted in many poor households having difficulty accessing market foods and Crisis (IPC Phase 3) outcomes are present. Thus, this Crisis Modifier action target lifesaving and livelihood protection activities including access to supplementary livestock feed, veterinary services, farm inputs, multipurpose cash transfer (cash-for-work, and unconditional), and response to the ongoing COVID-19 related WASH service.

The Overall Objective of the action is to saving lives and increased the coping capacity of vulnerable and at-risk populations affected by desert locust, COVID-19 related restrictions, and flooding in the RESET zone of influence. The Specific Objective of the action is to meet basic needs and protect livelihoods of vulnerable and at-risk households in Mubarak Woreda of Liben cluster under RESET II program through an integrated and gender-sensitive, multi-sectoral response. The Specific Objective will be achieved through two Results: R1) Improved access to WASH services. R2) Emergency and recovery livelihood needs of targeted households are met through the provision of appropriate livestock and crop inputs and cash support.
